definition: guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: And you're thinking - at last, they get their comeuppance.
sentences.chinese: 你或許在想，他們總算是罪有應得了。

sentences.english: Those criminals deserve to be locked up in jail.
sentences.chinese: 這些罪犯被關到堅牢是罪有應得。

sentences.english: But opponents believe that Mikhail Khodorkovsky embezzled a large number of state-owned assets, deserved.
sentences.chinese: 但反對者認爲，霍氏侵吞大量國有資產，罪有應得。

sentences.english: or, they are saying: " you deserved it".
sentences.chinese: 還有人會說，你罪有應得。
